Comment: Predicate suffix. Also iya kawaka 'go far'; aic̷a wenehɨ-wa-pa-i 'not finish-distributive-stative-incomplete'.
Respectively: 'middle-distributive-locative' (at the half), adverb; half-one side.
Respectively: 'middle-distributive-locative' (at the half), adverb; half-one side.
Note -ku'ma 'various/diverse'. Also pawã taputa-nɨ 'one put.down-in.focus' (i.e. one hand put down plus one), the usual format for numbers 6-10, after which toes are added.
Respectively: 'have-bubbling.sound' (narrow of places, etc.); 'quantity-linear-bone' (narrow of things).
Respectively: 'have-bubbling.sound' (narrow of places, etc.); 'quantity-linear-bone' (narrow of things).
Respectively: refers to things; 'large-in' (wide of trails, etc.). See 'heron' 03.583.
Respectively: refers to things; 'large-in' (wide of trails, etc.). See 'heron' 03.583.
Respectively: suffix; 'amount-small'; used of more than one item.
Respectively: suffix; 'amount-small'; used of more than one item.
Respectively: suffix; 'amount-small'; used of more than one item.
Respectively: open a door; open a lid.
Respectively: open a door; open a lid.
Respectively: 'something's place'; 'place-unspecified' (there). Also -taku 'place' (where something is found).
Respectively: 'something's place'; 'place-unspecified' (there). Also -taku 'place' (where something is found).
Lit. 'sit-causative', i.e. put out for sale.
Respectively: from Port. 'dinheiro'; a swelling, as a full pocket resembles a swelling.
Respectively: from Port. 'dinheiro'; a swelling, as a full pocket resembles a swelling.
Also iya pai-c̷u-pei, 'take 3rd.own-pronoun-become' (take to be his own).
Also mec̷ic̷i 'take in both hands'; -tawakuc̷a 'hold in arms'.
Respectively: also means 'go'; 'bring/take' multiple items. Also ta 'go/take' (defective verb); and apakic̷a 'carry'.
Respectively: also means 'go'; 'bring/take' multiple items. Also ta 'go/take' (defective verb); and apakic̷a 'carry'.
Lit. 'causative-have-owner-male.singular-causative'. Also -u and k(a)-; see previous entry.
Respectively: means to glide into landing; 'rise'.
Respectively: means to glide into landing; 'rise'.
Means 'canoe' (vessel). Can be expressed as ka-kanutapa-ki-'ya 'have-wrists-nominal-thing/person'.
Respectively: 'causative-go-to.focal.location-causative'; 'go/take-to.focal.location'. If many items are brought, apic̷a-ta, 'go/come-causative'.
Respectively: 'causative-go-to.focal.location-causative'; 'go/take-to.focal.location'. If many items are brought, apic̷a-ta, 'go/come-causative'.
Respectively: suffix means to go toward someone, or return home; 'go 3-to'; ?. Also awɨžɨkažɨta 'go directly to'.
Respectively: suffix means to go toward someone, or return home; 'go 3-to'; ?. Also awɨžɨkažɨta 'go directly to'.
Respectively: suffix means to go toward someone, or return home; 'go 3-to'; ?. Also awɨžɨkažɨta 'go directly to'.
Lit. 'causative-speed-causative-causative'; cf. 'run' 10.460. Also iya ɨ-malã-yã-ic̷a 'go 3rd-rear-locative-locative' (go after).
Lit. 'entering-causative' (pass through a doorway, in or out).
Latter means to blow on fire.
Latter means to blow on fire.
Both mean 'submerge'; latter can be trans.
Both mean 'submerge'; latter can be trans.
Lit. 'cause-positionally-twisting-cause (make something wriggle)'; and ĩyã, twist or spin (thread).
Also means 'fall'. Also wasitʸ-uwa 'throw-reflexive'; and a-taka-ta 'causative-fall-causative', trans.
Lit. 'return-to.focal.location'. Also tɨ-žɨžɨ-t-uwa '...-linearly-causative-reflexive' to be turning around; and mɨukata, to turn something over.
Refers to genipap; usually type of paint is specified.
Respectively: 'basket-in'; small open weave b. Also maya-pa-lu, 'basket-other-entity' (large b. made of poles and bark).
Respectively: 'basket-in'; small open weave b. Also maya-pa-lu, 'basket-other-entity' (large b. made of poles and bark).
Latter is red clay used for glaze on pots.
Latter is red clay used for glaze on pots.

Lit. 'have-pottery-vessel-possessed.nominal' (final stress). The Waurá are potters, with an extensive vocabulary depending on use, size, shape, etc. of the container. Note kamalu-pɨ ɨ-tuma-la-pic̷i-yeke-hɨ, 'clay-vessel 3rd-make-possessed-reference-owner-male.singular', expression that gives the pattern used for all non-indigenous trades, e.g. carpenter, etc.
Respectively: p. liquid; sound.of.pouring.powder-causative; p. semi-liquid things.
Respectively: p. liquid; sound.of.pouring.powder-causative; p. semi-liquid things.
Respectively: p. liquid; sound.of.pouring.powder-causative; p. semi-liquid things.
Respectively: of unstretchable objects; stretch elastic item.
Respectively: of unstretchable objects; stretch elastic item.
Requires a nominalizer and shape marker to specify the item. E.g. kalakã-tɨ, 'break-animate (-~)-cylinder' (person with broken limb), or a verb aspect suffix. Also keheneku, 'broken into pieces'.
Respectively: b. a solid object; 'privative-tying.materials', b. thread, rope, etc.
Respectively: b. a solid object; 'privative-tying.materials', b. thread, rope, etc.
Lit. 'rocking-linear' (because of the shape of the links).
Refers to Buriti palm; no generic term.
Respectively: also means 'thatch' 07.520; 'tree-skin' 04.120, refers to inner bark useful for tying.
Respectively: also means 'thatch' 07.520; 'tree-skin' 04.120, refers to inner bark useful for tying.
Latter is 'tree/wood-leaf', also used for paper.
Latter is 'tree/wood-leaf', also used for paper.
Lit. 'seed/granular'. Also used as a shape morpheme, meaning 'cylinder, (grain.shaped) / round'. Has allomorphs: -tɨ; -c̷i.
Also means 'comb'. If it has a handle, palata-napɨ, 'comb-bone'.
Latter is 'cane-footshaped', the woman chief's stool.
Latter is 'cane-footshaped', the woman chief's stool.
Poss. from Port. 'cobertor'; however, cf. -petu, a cover for food.
Lit. 'fire-...'; refers to anyplace a fire is made.
Respectively: lit. 'house-wall-unspecified' (wallposts); 'shield, partition'. Also pãa-c̷u-kic̷i, 'house-wall-thatch'. The houses are thatched to the ground.
Respectively: lit. 'house-wall-unspecified' (wallposts); 'shield, partition'. Also pãa-c̷u-kic̷i, 'house-wall-thatch'. The houses are thatched to the ground.
Means the actual door. The doorway (space) is 'house-mouth', pãi-tʸana-tɨ, lit. 'house-hollow-cylinder'.
Same as 'men's house' 07.160; women only enter for rare special gatherings.
Lit. 'river/home.area-in-area', the central area in a circular village.
Prob. 'its-field.house-possessed', where it refers to -petežɨ, the field which must qualify it.
The latter form refers to a side product of refining salt.
The latter form refers to a side product of refining salt.
Respectively: lit. '...-head' (feather headdress); 'head-clothes' (cane head-ring). Also kɨžu-mapɨ, feather headband to cover ring.
Respectively: lit. '...-head' (feather headdress); 'head-clothes' (cane head-ring). Also kɨžu-mapɨ, feather headband to cover ring.
Lit. 'ear-cylinder'; Waurá ear ornaments are cylindrical.
Lit. 'head-clothes', a cane ring worn on the head.
Lit. 'its-design', about cotton. Also individual color names nominalized by final stress, e.g. mɨhɨ'ža, 'red dye'. -ɣa 'liquid' is added if it is fluid.
Latter is 'spin-linear'. Also kuwa-pi, 'outer.thigh-linear', from manner of using leg for spinning.
Latter is 'spin-linear'. Also kuwa-pi, 'outer.thigh-linear', from manner of using leg for spinning.
Lit. 'outer.thigh-linear-leg' from manner of using the leg for spinning.
Respectively: lit. 'have-submerge-possessed-liquid', used of thick soup or jam; 'pepper-distributive-liquid' (watery soup).
Respectively: lit. 'have-submerge-possessed-liquid', used of thick soup or jam; 'pepper-distributive-liquid' (watery soup).
Lit. 'manioc-mass', used with modifiers for other breads.
Respectively: (made of) clay; gourd (also used for 'spoon').
Respectively: (made of) clay; gourd (also used for 'spoon').
Respectively: clay-container (large); medium-large; small. Also he'že, griddle, bakestone.
Respectively: clay-container (large); medium-large; small. Also he'že, griddle, bakestone.
Respectively: clay-container (large); medium-large; small. Also he'že, griddle, bakestone.
Respectively: clay container (large); medium large; small, generic terms; see 'potter' 09.710.
Respectively: clay container (large); medium large; small, generic terms; see 'potter' 09.710.
Respectively: clay container (large); medium large; small, generic terms; see 'potter' 09.710.
Respectively: 'make; bake'. Also talaka; and a-hulũžɨ-ta, lit. 'causative-roasted.corn/grubs-causative'. Each verb is specific for item cooked on the griddle; they are not interchangeable.
Respectively: 'make; bake'. Also talaka; and a-hulũžɨ-ta, lit. 'causative-roasted.corn/grubs-causative'. Each verb is specific for item cooked on the griddle; they are not interchangeable.
Respectively: lit. 'causative-roasted.food-causative' (to roast on a rack); 'causative-roasted.food' (r. on coals). Also 'fry' c̷ɨka.
Respectively: lit. 'causative-roasted.food-causative' (to roast on a rack); 'causative-roasted.food' (r. on coals). Also 'fry' c̷ɨka.
Respectively: rotten animal material; r. vegetable material.
Respectively: rotten animal material; r. vegetable material.
Respectively: noun; verbal form, 'cause-poison-cause'. Also tee'te, possibly from insecticide DDT.
Respectively: noun; verbal form, 'cause-poison-cause'. Also tee'te, possibly from insecticide DDT.
-hemu- occurs in words for dents, and injuries.
Lit. 'have-...'. Cf. 'weak' 04.820. Also kehežuka 'hard'; ɨ-mɨna-wana '3rd-bodily/ lesser-arm' (great, strong); kauma-kanatɨ 'power-mouth' (powerful).
Lit. 'cause-have-killer-male-causative', not accepted by everyone. Some prefer maitʸ-, 'hit'.
Lit. 'cause-corpse', also used of being ill.
Used of the father too. Also -c̷itʸu-pa-i ɨ-tãi, 'womb-stative-incomplete 3rd-small'.
Lit. means cold weather, used with verb suffixes for 'shiver'.
Note that -tɨ means 'seed, cylindrical, grain-shaped'. See 'grain' 08.420.
Lit. 'end-all'; -misara-taku '...-area', if the person is thin.
Lit. 'middle, back of waist'; also ka-wãata-i, 'have-belt-unspecified, front of waist'.
Lit. 'umbilical-cylinder'. The umbilical cord is -tukuna-pi, umbilicus-linear'.
Lit. 'liver-surface' 04.450, (lower part of chest—over liver). Also -hɨ̃-penu, breast, upper part of chest.
Lit. 'foot-foot.shaped'. Allomorphs for shape morpheme are: tapa, c̷apa.
The latter is only used as part of other words, as in 'finger' 04.340.
The latter is only used as part of other words, as in 'finger' 04.340.
Lit. 'hollow-cylinder'; refers to actual mouth. -numa refers to mouth as part of the face, mainly used in compounds.
Same as 'ear'. To be specific, one can say -tulũ-tɨ-pɨku, 'ear-cylinder-place', the ear ornament's place.
Also means 'hair' 04.140. Used in word formation in many words, e.g. 'firewood', lit. 'fire-head' 01.880. Has allomorphs: -tɨwɨ, -c̷iwi, -tiwi.
Lit. 'its.tail'. A firm tail requires a shape marker.
Used for 'veins, arteries, nerves'; suffix -pi means 'linear'.
Also means 'whiskers'; -numa has to do with the mouth or snout.
Many others, such as: mayu'wa; ũ'tɨ.
Many others, such as: mayu'wa; ũ'tɨ.
Many others, such as: mayu'wa; ũ'tɨ.
Many species; the latter is a toad (sapo).
Many species; the latter is a toad (sapo).
Many kinds, species names are usually used.
And other varieties, such as alama.
And other varieties, such as alama.
Refers to the 'tarantula'. Also yuwa-tãi, small spider.
Respectively: 'fire-ant'; 'black ant'. Also wayatɨwɨ, 'army-ant', and others.
Respectively: 'fire-ant'; 'black ant'. Also wayatɨwɨ, 'army-ant', and others.
Lit. 'snake 3rd-comb-possessed (nasalization)'; (nasalization and stress shift to final syllable).
May refer also to things in general.
Refers to 'capuchin'. Other varieties: kapulu; kapulu-ku'ma; kuc̷i-kuc̷i.
The latter is 'have-spot-area', the spotted stingray.
The latter is 'have-spot-area', the spotted stingray.
Refers to 'mouse'. Also mukutɨ-ku'ma, 'mouse-various, rat, guineapig'.
Also ĩyãu, ideophonic (miao), which also means 'person' 02.100. So called because of cats' relationship to jaguar, the father of mankind's creator.
Respectively: species of pigeon; species of dove.
Respectively: species of pigeon; species of dove.
Lit. 'duck-various', using the name of one species of duck.
Lit. 'collared.peccary-various', also used for donkey and pig.
Lit. 'big-ear-area'. Also autu-ku'ma 'collared.peccary-various', also used for pig and mule.
Pronoun form. Also prefixes yi-; yV-, with vowel harmony.
Pronoun form. Also aw-; ai-; aV-, with vowel harmony.
Pronoun form. Also aw-; ai-; aV-, with vowel harmony.
Pronoun form. Also aw-; ai-; aV-, with vowel harmony.
The 3rd person form ɨ-tu is only used as a possessive. Also ɨ-; V-, with vowel harmony.
Pronoun form. Also prefixes pi-; pV-, with vowel harmony.
Pronoun form. Also prefixes: nu-; nV-, with vowel harmony.
Lit. 'kin-male'. Excludes actual parents and siblings. Has male suffix, but includes female kin.
Lit. 'mother-slightly', with irregular possession, as for 'mother'.
Lit. 'father-slightly', with irregular possession as for 'father'.
Cross cousin; parallel cousins are considered as siblings. tanule-žu, 'cross.cousin-female'.
Respectively: 'woman's brother's son'; 'man's sister's son'. Offspring of sibling of ego's sex are sons and daughters of ego.
Respectively: 'woman's brother's son'; 'man's sister's son'. Offspring of sibling of ego's sex are sons and daughters of ego.
Lit. 'younger.sibling-female', only of sister of a woman.
Lit. 'older.sibling-female', only of sister of a woman.
Lit. 'sibling-reciprocal-female', only of sister of a man.
Lit. 'younger.sibling-male', only of a man's brother.
Lit. 'older.sibling-male', only of a man's brother.
Lit. 'sibling-reciprocal.nominal', only of brother of a woman.
First form refers to 1st person's father. It occurs with irregular possession: -žɨ; -ežɨ; -kɨ'žɨ.
First form refers to 1st person's father. It occurs with irregular possession: -žɨ; -ežɨ; -kɨ'žɨ.
Becomes -ri, next to /i/; also nasalization of the preceding vowel. I.e., it has two morphologically conditioned allomorphs: -žɨ (-ri) and nasalization.
Also used for 'cat' 03.620, q.v., because both are related to the jaguar.
The latter refers to a possessed fire.
The latter refers to a possessed fire.
Lit. 'can/do.not-conditional.nominal (stress)', referring to mist which comes down from above. Also sĩyãla-wa-ka, 'smoke-distributed-area' 01.830, referring to 'rising mist'.
Lit. 'rain-mass'; also unɨ-pe, 'water-mass' (of dark rain cloud). Note vowel harmony; cf. 'rain' 01.750.
Lit. 'high-tie' (tie using a spell). Also enu-kãi-c̷ũ, 'high-sound-...'.
Also uni-yene, 'water-stream'; u-ta-wana, 'water-specific-arm/ branch'; unɨ-tɨ-napu, 'water-cylinder (grain.shaped) -trail'; -u-tɨ, 'water-cylinder (grain.shaped)'; refer to various kinds of streams.
Also used for 'rain' 01.750. In some words only u- is used, as in n-u-ža, 'my-water-possessed'.
Latter 'in a short while'. Also me-neke 'not-yet'.
Latter 'in a short while'. Also me-neke 'not-yet'.
Each hour of the day and night has a name, all descriptive clauses.
Lit. 'sun-area', with possession markers indicating whose age or plans are involved.
Lit. 'sun-area-distributive' (dry season); called 'summer' by some Brazilians. See 'year' 14.730.
Lit. 'wind-in-distributive-area', because of the late dry season winds.
All specify a different type of odor.
All specify a different type of odor.
All specify a different type of odor.
All specify a different type of odor.
Also used for 'sense, feel, smell'. Also ka-tulũ-naku 'have-ear-in' (be able to hear, listen).
Respectively: blue or green (less used for green now), darker shades; 'have-rain-water' (light blue).
Respectively: blue or green (less used for green now), darker shades; 'have-rain-water' (light blue).
Respectively: lit. '-person/ other-reference'; 'likeness-reference'. Also -yuwežɨ-ku 'core-in' (ghost, spirit); see 'nut' 05.770.
Respectively: lit. '-person/ other-reference'; 'likeness-reference'. Also -yuwežɨ-ku 'core-in' (ghost, spirit); see 'nut' 05.770.
Respectively: brave under provocation; b. under pain.
Respectively: brave under provocation; b. under pain.
Latter is modifier. Also kamalatɨ 'bad, dirty'; kɨmeyũpã 'disgusting, bad'; kawɨka'pa 'eerie, bad'; kɨhakala 'unpleasant, bad'.
Latter is modifier. Also kamalatɨ 'bad, dirty'; kɨmeyũpã 'disgusting, bad'; kawɨka'pa 'eerie, bad'; kɨhakala 'unpleasant, bad'.
Second form also means 'hear, sense'; final form also means 'know'.
Second form also means 'hear, sense'; final form also means 'know'.
Second form also means 'hear, sense'; final form also means 'know'.
Respectively: 'know' (fact or person); know how to, 'have-ability.to'.
Respectively: 'know' (fact or person); know how to, 'have-ability.to'.
Former is 'causative-likeness-causative'. Also ukužata imitate (ancestor's ways).
Former is 'causative-likeness-causative'. Also ukužata imitate (ancestor's ways).
Lit. 'what-reason'; is the only use of -manɨ.
Also means 'greet'. In naming requires i-c̷enu '3rd-with' (for name, or direct object).
Latter is name of a spirit.
Latter is name of a spirit.
Latter is name of a spirit.
Means margin; note -pi linear. Also ɨ-kehɨ-tɨ-ža i-c̷epu '3rd-earth-grain-possessed 3rd-end'.
Lit. 'person-plural/human'. Also putaka-naku-weke-ne 'Xingu.Indian-in-owner-group' (dwellers in the village).
Respectively: staff, crutch; 'bow'; 'arrow', both used as sceptre, rod of office.
Respectively: staff, crutch; 'bow'; 'arrow', both used as sceptre, rod of office.
Respectively: staff, crutch; 'bow'; 'arrow', both used as sceptre, rod of office.

Lit. 'king.vulture-on-locative-cylinder' (enthroned person); ulupu-pe'nu 'chief's stool'. Also putaka-naku-weke-hɨ 'Xingu.Indian-in-owner.male.singular' (village chief). Also kehɨtɨ ɨwekehɨ, the land's owner, presiding chief.
Also ɨn-enɨžãa-pĩyẽic̷i; and ɨ-tɨ-nežũ-pĩyẽic̷i, '3rd-male-...' and '3rd-cylinder-female-...' respectively. pĩyẽic̷i is used with the word for name to mean namesake.
Respectively: also means 'hear, feel, sense'; 'believe, trust, obey'.
Respectively: also means 'hear, feel, sense'; 'believe, trust, obey'.
Former is 'with'; requires final stress or -lu to indicate male or female companion.
Former is 'with'; requires final stress or -lu to indicate male or female companion.
Lit. 'causative-with-causative'. Also a-ka-tũpa-i-c̷a 'causative-have-deceased-unspecified-causative', because the helped will miss the helper.
Lit. 'harm-unspecified'. Also iya muteic̷i-tʸei 'go war-topic'; and nuka-ki-tʸeku 'harm-unspecified-doing'.
Respectively: 'arrow'; from Port. 'canhão'. Also kažaɨpa ɨn-uku-la 'non-Indian's arrow'.
Respectively: 'arrow'; from Port. 'canhão'. Also kažaɨpa ɨn-uku-la 'non-Indian's arrow'.
Former is also used as a classifier 'net/area'.
Former is also used as a classifier 'net/area'.
Traps are designated by different shapes.
Traps are designated by different shapes.

Respectively: trap fish; 'causative-birdlime-causative' use birdlime (a fruit sap) to trap birds.
Respectively: trap fish; 'causative-birdlime-causative' use birdlime (a fruit sap) to trap birds.
Lit. 'causative-have-killer-causative'; a form not accepted by all Waurá.
Also means the wood used in sorcery.
